page.title: 03SHEEP FARMING,CARBOST
page.content: Although there are a few cows and hens in our area,by far the most common animal is the sheep.They are mainly Blackface,with some Suffolk-crosses and Cheviots.Approximately 2,000 in number,some belong to Sheep Clubs and others belong to individual farmers or crofters. The sheep are very often on the single-track road,grazing for food,and in Spring many new-born lambs are killed by traffic.This makes many sheep-owners very angry because often people do not even stop when this happens.It is felt that traffic moves far too fast on the narrow roads.However,some people in the area also feel that the sheep should be fenced in,especially in the village, because they foul the road and paths.
